Description: A sealing for an unknown object, probably a document: oval impression from an intaglio gem of a warrior-god, probably Heron or Harpokrates, his right arm raised, on horseback, riding to right on a baseline; two other very partial stamps from the same gem remain. The surface was covered with cloth before the impressions were made. A deep cross-shaped mark has been cut into the sealing below the main impression. Unfired pale yellow-brown mud.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Donated: Egypt Exploration Society. Roman, probably second century AD.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3639)
